Name: Active
Example description: Selects the active link

Name: Checked
Example description: Selects every checked <input> element

Name: Disabled
Example description: Selects every disabled <input> element

Name: Empty
Example description:
Selects every

element that has no children

Name: Enabled
Example description: Selects every enabled <input> element

Name: First Child
Example description:
Selects every

elements that is the first child of its parent

Name: First of Type
Example description:
Selects every

element that is the first

element of its parent

Name: Focus
Example description: Selects the <input> element that has focus

Name: Hover
Example description: Selects links on mouse over

Name: In Range
Example description: Selects <input> elements with a value within a specified range

Name: Invalid
Example description: Selects all <input> elements with an invalid value

Name: Last Child
Example description:
Selects every

elements that is the last child of its parent

Name: Last of Type
Example description:
Selects every

element that is the last

element of its parent

Name: Link
Example description: Selects all unvisited links

Name: Only of Type
Example description:
Selects every

element that is the only

element of its parent

Name: Only Child
Example description:
Selects every

element that is the only child of its parent

Name: Optional
Example description: Selects <input> elements with no "required" attribute

Name: Out of Range
Example description: Selects <input> elements with a value outside a specified range

Name: Read Only
Example description: Selects <input> elements with a "readonly" attribute specified

Name: Read Write
Example description: Selects <input> elements with no "readonly" attribute

Name: Required
Example description: Selects <input> elements with a "required" attribute specified

Name: Valid
Example description: Selects all <input> elements with a valid value

Name: Visites
Example description: Selects all visited links

Name: Placeholder
Example description: Selects every <input> element that has placeholder

Name: After
Example description:
Insert content after every

element

Name: Before
Example description:
Insert content before every

element

Name: First Letter
Example description:
Selects the first letter of every

element

Name: First Line
Example description:
Selects the first line of every

element

Name: Selection
Example description: Selects the portion of an element that is selected by a user

Name: Target
Example description: Selects the current active #news element (clicked on a URL containing that anchor name)

Name: Language is…
Example description:
Selects every

element with a lang attribute value starting with "it"

Name: Is Not…
Example description:
Selects every element that is not a

element

Name: # Child
Example description:
Selects every

element that is the second child of its parent

Name: # Last Child
Example description:
Selects every

element that is the second child of its parent, counting from the last child

Name: # Last of Type
Example description:
Selects every

element that is the second

element of its parent, counting from the last child

Name: # of Type
Example description:
Selects every

element that is the second

element of its parent

Name: Root
Example description: Selects the document's root element
